steps.description: Initialize the project with your framework of choice (Spring Boot, Express, etc.)
Set up service registration with Consul, Eureka, or Kubernetes service discovery
Add /health/live and /health/ready endpoints for container orchestration
Configure structured logging with correlation IDs
Integrate Prometheus metrics or similar monitoring
Set up OpenAPI/Swagger documentation
Add JWT or OAuth2 authentication middleware
Build optimized Docker image with multi-stage builds
Create project with your chosen framework (React, Vue, Angular, etc.)
Set up Webpack Module Federation or similar technology
Configure which components/routes to expose to the shell
Implement routing that integrates with the shell application
Define shared libraries to avoid duplication
Add error boundaries to prevent cascading failures
Configure CI/CD for independent deployment
Set up deployment to CDN with versioning
Define Kubernetes Deployment with replicas, resources, and probes
Define Kubernetes Service for service discovery
Set up Ingress for external access with proper routing
Externalize configuration and sensitive data
Configure CPU and memory requests/limits
Set up HorizontalPodAutoscaler based on metrics
Deploy using kubectl apply or Helm charts
Check pod status, logs, and run smoke tests
Test individual components in isolation with mocked dependencies
Test service with real dependencies (database, message queue)
Verify API contracts with consumer-driven contract testing
Test REST/gRPC endpoints with various scenarios
Perform load testing to identify performance bottlenecks
Test resilience by introducing failures
Search centralized logs using correlation ID
Use distributed tracing (Jaeger, Zipkin) to follow request path
Review service metrics for anomalies (latency, errors, saturation)
Check health endpoints and service discovery status
Verify environment variables and configuration values
Test the service in isolation to identify dependencies
Check recent deployments and configuration changes
Attach debugger or use remote debugging if needed
